etymology.interpretation: The character 冈(岡) (gāng, "ridge") is originally a pictogram representing a net, which was later adapted for its current meaning "ridge" because of its visual resemblance to the outlines of hills or ridges.
etymology.simplification: 冈(岡) is a cursive shorthand form that eliminates the inner part of the original traditional form while retaining the outer lines representing the ridge.

examples.chinese: 翻越山冈(翻越山冈)，便能看到远方(便能看到遠方)。
examples.pinyin: Fān yuè shān gāng, biàn néng kàn dào yuǎn fāng.
examples.english: After crossing the ridge, one can see the distant horizon.

examples.chinese: 他沿着冈脊(他沿着冈脊)，寻觅失落的宝藏(尋覓失落的寶藏)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yán zhe gāng jí, xún mì shī luò de bǎo zàng.
examples.english: He follows the ridge crest, searching for the lost treasure.
